nodes.label: Claim 01
nodes.summary: Core thesis statement for scaffold stability.

nodes.label: Evidence 02
nodes.summary: Empirical signal that supports major thesis claims.

nodes.label: Method 03
nodes.summary: Methodological frame used to transform claims into measurements.

nodes.label: Assumption 04
nodes.summary: Assumed stability conditions for interpretation consistency.

nodes.label: Limitation 05
nodes.summary: Known boundary where model simplification may break.

nodes.label: Context 06
nodes.summary: Institutional and social setting that constrains interpretation.

nodes.label: Evidence 07
nodes.summary: Auxiliary evidence with moderate corroboration strength.

nodes.label: Method 08
nodes.summary: Secondary operational procedure for robustness checking.

nodes.label: Assumption 09
nodes.summary: Background prior required for inference continuity.

nodes.label: Limitation 10
nodes.summary: Edge case where external validity may degrade.

nodes.label: Evidence 12
nodes.summary: Residual evidence used to challenge weak links.

edges.rationale: Primary evidence directly reinforces the thesis.
Method creates executable structure for the claim.
Method quality depends on this assumption.
Known boundary conditions constrain claim strength.
Interpretation must account for contextual environment.
Supplementary evidence backs primary evidence quality.
Residual evidence exposes uncertainty in support strength.
Residual evidence pressures the central claim directly.
